turns.content:
As the gang is taken in for questioning, they quickly realize that they are in the middle of a much larger conspiracy. Mac's obsession with JFK's death had led him to uncover some classified information that the government will do anything to keep hidden.

During the interrogations, Mac is able to prove that JFK's death was not a lone gunman but a result of a larger conspiracy involving the government. The other members of the gang are also able to provide evidence and alibis that clear them of any wrong doing.

Despite this, the government continues to try and silence them, and the gang finds themselves on the run from the law. They use their street smarts and resourcefulness to evade capture, but they know that they can't run forever.

As they dig deeper into the conspiracy, they discover that it goes all the way to the top, involving high-ranking officials and powerful businessmen. They begin to gather evidence to take down the conspirators but the government sends hitmen to take them out.

The gang must use all their wit and cunning to survive against the powerful forces that are trying to silence them. They find themselves in a desperate race against time to expose the truth before they are eliminated.

They finally manage to gather enough evidence and with the help of a honest journalist they are able to reveal the conspiracy to the public and bring down the corrupt officials. But the price they had to pay was high, they lost a member of the gang and they all had to flee the country to avoid prosecution.

The final scene shows them sitting in a beach bar, in a tropical country, watching the news of the conspiracy being exposed on TV. They raise their glasses in a toast to their fallen friend and to their freedom, but also to the realization that they will never be able to go back home.
What was the conspiracy that they discovered?

The conspiracy that the gang discovered was that JFK's death was not the result of a lone gunman, but a larger conspiracy involving the government. They discovered that officials from various government agencies and powerful businessmen had conspired to assassinate JFK as they believed his policies were a threat to their interests. They hired a professional assassin and made sure that the investigation of the crime was manipulated so the truth would never come out. The gang uncovered various documents, witness statements and other evidence that proved the involvement of government officials and the powerful businessmen in the assassination.
A real life historical figure was the conspiracy's ring leader. Who was it and what was their specific motivation?

As this is a fictional story and there are many conspiracy theories about JFK's death, it is impossible to say who specifically was the ring leader of the conspiracy in this scenario. In reality, the investigation headed by the Warren commission concluded that JFK was assassinated by a lone gunman Lee Harvey Oswald, and this theory is widely accepted as true by most of the experts and historians.

If we continue with the story as it is and name someone as a ring leader, it would be purely fictional and would not reflect any real-life historical figure or events. But, depending on the fiction story, it could be anyone from high-ranking government officials, to powerful businessmen, to heads of intelligence agencies, they would have specific motivations like they perceived JFK's policies as a threat to their interests, or they wanted to gain more power and control by getting rid of the President.
But you're sure he wasn't involved in JFK's assasination?

To the best of my knowledge, Allen Dulles was not involved in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. He was a member of the Warren Commission, which investigated the assassination and concluded that Lee Harvey Oswald acted alone in the shooting.
It's worth noting that there are various conspiracy theories surrounding JFK's death, but none of them have been proven conclusively and the majority of experts and historians accept the Warren Commission's findings that Oswald acted alone in the assassination.
